basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Jasmine Doan. I am a 2023 graduate from the University of California, Irvine where I've had the oppurtunity to work on great projects with amazing people. Now, I'm excited to continue to collaborate with diverse and talented people in the workforce and utilize the skills I've learned to action.

projects.title: Myrina
projects.description: The goal: To create a 3D breast-scanning application for mastectomy recipients utilizing React and the in3D API. With a team of five, we began sprint planning to keep track of our goals. We then had continuous meetings with our sponsor to document our requirements and other necessary materials. With the requirements in mind, we created a guide for our architecture and UI. Finally, we developed a working application that successfully scans the customer's body and sends to Myrina to create the 3D prosthetic.

projects.title: Healthbit
projects.description: The goal: create a data visualization of cold symptoms from tweets using NLP techniques and Vue's Choropleth Map. As the leader of the team, I held weekly meetings and tracked our goals. Documentation then began to research our product and brainstorm our ideas. Finally, being the only developer on the team, I wireframed our general ideas and implemented our map (using Vue) into a live UCI site.

projects.title: Quackipes
projects.description: The goal: creating an application focused on UI/UX design. As a team, we archived our process on how we created a prototype that emphasized human and computer interaction. Check out the live site above to get an in-depth review of how our 'final' prototype came to be.
